heading: Welcome
text:
Welcome YaRDS, Yet another R Data Science Course.
introductory course Data Science, taught using R language RStudio.
core content course focuses data acquisition data wrangling, exploratory data analysis, data visualization, effective communication results.

heading: Who is this course for?
text:
learner interested making sense (sometimes messy) data whohas little background data science, statistics, programming, orhas using R wants modernize skills,materials course !
content definitely newcomer friendly, however willing ask questions dive documentation packages introduce.
course designed accessible new learners undergraduate level , though adventurous learners high school level might also enjoy materials.

heading: 9 Data science ethics
text:
unit touches data science ethics, specifically issues misrepresentation data results, data privacy, algorithmic bias.
Course lectures supplemented “guest lectures” domain experts.

heading: 9.4.3.1 Criteria
text: project assessed following criteria:Content - quality research /policy question relevancy data questions?Correctness - statistical procedures carried explained correctly?Writing Presentation - quality statistical presentation, writing, explanations?Creativity Critical Thought - project carefully thought ? limitations carefully considered? appear time effort went planning implementation project?general breakdown scoring follows:90%-100% - Outstanding effort. Student understands apply statistical concepts, can put results cogent argument, can identify weaknesses argument, can clearly communicate results others.80%-89% - Good effort. Student understands concepts, puts together adequate argument, identifies weaknesses argument, communicates results clearly others.70%-79% - Passing effort. Student misunderstanding concepts several areas, trouble putting results together cogent argument, communication results sometimes unclear.60%-69% - Struggling effort. Student making effort, misunderstanding many concepts unable put together cogent argument. Communication results unclear.60% - Student making sufficient effort.
